value: (Poland Plaza) - Constructed during the city's first centennial in homage to Polish immigrante, the plaza has a playground with trees and benches.
- Reinaugurated in September 2003 after renovation, this plaza holds the new Campo Largo Museum and the 500 Year Memorial. Gardens with benches, public telephones, and a monthly night market.
- Inaugurated in October 1972 during the sesquicentennial of Brazil's independence, this tree-lined 0plaza is home to  a church, Igreja Matriz de Nossa Senhora da Piedade.
- Tree-lined plaza which contains the Fountain of Campo Largo and some flower gardens.
, Av. Padre Natal Pigatt, near the city entrance. Constructed in honor of the new millennium.

, this park has bike paths, barbecue grills, public bathrooms, an event stage, soccer fields and a playground.
- 180 hectares situated 3.4 kilometers from the center of town in the neighborhood of Granja, this park contains the ruins of the city's first school and medical clinic.

, Estrada do cerne, Km 34 – Bateias, (41) 3648-1346 . At 38 meters it's the tallest waterfall around and it makes for a good rappelling spot. Sat. and Sun. from 8AM-5PM or by reservation.
, access by Bateias or Cerne streets near the district of Bateias.  This spot gives a panoramic view of the region, providing even a glimpse of
. Despite being sought out by trekkers and mountain-bikers, the grounds still lack adequate infrastructure.

- Cutting through Sede district in the southwest part of town, this is the only river in the region whose mouth lies on the state's coast. Despite having no touristic infrastructure, part of the river is popular for rafting.

(The Porcelain Route) - A privately funded initiative to educate visitors about the production of ceramics and porcelain. The route includes a visit to two different types of factories, lunch, and a visit to a colonial cafe at the end of the afternoon. Various products can be purchased at the ceramics shops along the route.
, Rua XV de Novembro – sala 41 – Shopping XV, (41) 3392-3844.

content=– Centro. This place has laundry service, but has no covered parking and no telephones in the rooms.

, Av. Ayrton Senna da Silva, 4056 – Bom Jesus, (41) 3393-4671. Currently in expansion, the hotel offers rooms with TV and private bathroom, although the telephones are still being installed. There is parking but it isn't covered. Breakfast and snacks.
, Rod. do Café – Br 277 s/n Km 126, (41) 3292-2677. 22 rooms and 2 suites. Only the suites have private bathrooms and televisions. An on-site restaurant provides meals but there is no parking garage.

, access by the Faxina highway. Beginning in the Iguaçu River valley in the here south of the state and extending beyond the Itararé River in São Paulo state, this is the border between the Paraná's two plateau regions. Canyons and caves have led some companies to offer sporting and adventure activities in the area.
, situated 50 km away in Três Córregos, (41) 3322-5125. A multi-use forest preserve for sap-collecting, beekeeping, seed-gathering, logging, and environmental education. Guided visits only.
